page.title: 20From my open door
page.content:
It is mostly family farms around here about a hundred acres each. In the main it is milk production in the valley, and rearing cattles and sheep on the hills. Some of the hedges have been bulldozed down,but as far as I can see the fields are about 4-5 acres each, and from here I can only see one ploughed field. Change and progress is the talk all the time with our men; even our Milk Factory has changed its name to St Ivel (Unigate) and in three years, two small farms over the road from here have gone and only the farmhouse is occupied.
This information was compiled by Hemyock WI: Members,Mesdames Clist,Ewins,Flemming,Shepherd,Shepard, Misses Brown and Sheppard.Mr Peter Reed contributed 'Heat Pumps'.Computer loan and help by Hemyock C P School.
